doc.field: Records of the Rudin Center for Transportation Policy and Management
Records of the Rudin Center for Transportation Policy and Management

The Rudin Center for Transportation Policy and Management is a research institute based at the Robert F. Wagner Graduate School of Public Service at New York University. The Center conducts and disseminates research on infrastructure and transportation policy, as well as the connections between these areas and social and economic issues. The Records of the Rudin Center for Transportation Policy and Management consists of reports produced by faculty and research staff of the Rudin Center.

The Rudin Center for Transportation Policy and Management is a research institute based at the Robert F. Wagner Graduate School of Public Service at New York University. The Center conducts and disseminates research on infrastructure and transportation policy, as well as the connections between these areas and social and economic issues.
Transferred by Tess von Kleist, Rudin Center for Transportation Policy and Management, NYU Wagner, in March 2024; the accession number associated with this transfer is 2024.024.
